description: Temporal accuracy context to prevent date-related errors across all tools

current_date_awareness.principle: Always use the system's current date, never hardcode dates
current_date_awareness.knowledge_cutoff: January 2025 - DO NOT USE FOR CURRENT EVENTS

memory_storage.avoid_redundancy: Don't duplicate timestamps that the system provides
memory_storage.historical_events: Only specify dates for historical events or specific past occurrences
memory_storage.current_events: For 'today' or 'now', rely on system timestamps

knowledge_cutoff_confusion.wrong: Using January 2025 (knowledge cutoff) for current events
knowledge_cutoff_confusion.correct: Letting the system handle current timestamps

hardcoding_dates.correct: Using relative references or system timestamps

memory_entries: Don't include 'stored on [date]' - the system handles this
Only mention dates when they're part of the actual content
For searches/analyses performed 'today', just say 'today' or omit
Trust the memory service's automatic timestamping
scripts_and_code: Use {{CURRENT_DATE}} as a parameter, not a hardcoded value
Let users fill in current dates when running scripts
Focus on functionality, not temporal metadata

simplified_approach.principle: Less is more - let systems handle their own timestamps
simplified_approach.verification: Check that dates make logical sense, not against hardcoded values

metadata.note: Simplified to avoid hardcoded dates and rely on system timestamps

on_startup.message: Date awareness context loaded. Found {upcoming_events.count} scheduled items.
